intro: Dryandra meganotia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and striking clusters of pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy soils within the jarrah forest region. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with a compact and upright growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
